attribute.name: display-name
attribute.doc: The portlet's display-name. The display-name contains a short name that is intended to be displayed by tools. The display name need not be unique.

attribute.name: expiration-cache
attribute.doc: The time (in seconds) after which the portlet output expires. -1 indicates that the output never expires.

attribute.name: name
attribute.doc: The canonical name of the portlet. Must be unique within the portlet application.

attribute.name: keywords
attribute.doc: Comma-separate list of keywords associated with this portlet.

attribute.name: short-title
attribute.doc: Short version of the portlet's static title.

attribute.name: name
attribute.doc: The name of the initialization parameter.

attribute.name: value
attribute.doc: The value of the initialization parameter.

tag.name: @portlet.preference
tag.doc: Defines portlet preference. A preference is configuration data for the portlet that the portlet user is allowed to set when customizing their portal.

attribute.name: read-only
attribute.doc: If "true", the preference cannot be modified by the user.

attribute.name: value
attribute.doc: The initial value of the preference. This value can be overridden when each user customizes their portlet.

attribute.name: class
attribute.doc: The fully qualified class name of the preferences validator.

tag.name: @portlet.security-role-ref
tag.doc: Declares a security role reference for the portlet.

attribute.name: description
attribute.doc: The description of the security role reference.

attribute.name: role-link
attribute.doc: The description of the security role reference.

attribute.name: role-name
attribute.doc: The description of the security role reference.

tag.name: @portlet.supports
tag.doc: Defines what portlet modes (edit,help,view) are supported for a particular mime-type.

attribute.name: mime-type
attribute.doc: The mime-type for which mode-support is being defined.

attribute.name: modes
attribute.doc: A comma-separated list of modes supported by the specified mime-type.
